001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders;
002
003import java.util.Optional;
004
005import io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic;
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.ImmutableInHostPhenomenologicalState;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.InHostPhenomenologicalState;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic;
009import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
010import io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.PhenomenologicalModel;
011import io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils;
012import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
013
014/**
015 * Default initialiser for the phenomenological in‑host model.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This interface provides the default logic to construct an
019 * {@link InHostPhenomenologicalState} from a {@link PhenomenologicalModel}
020 * configuration and execution parameters. It samples the incubation and
021 * viral/immune peak timings and calibrates simple biphasic logistic models used
022 * to represent viral load and immune response.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * Role in composition: this initialiser is composed into
026 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultPersonInitialiser} and
027 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder}. The
028 * {@code DefaultModelBuilder} delegates to this interface's default method to
029 * create a person's phenomenological in‑host state. Replacing the in‑host
030 * behaviour can be done by substituting this interface or by overriding the
031 * delegation point in a subclass of the model builder.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * Demographic adjustment: where a {@link PersonDemographic} is supplied the
035 * configuration is adjusted with
036 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils#modify} prior to sampling so that
037 * age or group specific scalings provided by
038 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.DemographicAdjustment.Phenomenological}
039 * are applied.
040 *
041 * <p>
042 * Extension guidance: keep this initialiser focused on creating the immutable
043 * in‑host state and avoid heavy IO; any expensive precomputation should be
044 * performed at outbreak baselining.
045 *
046 * @author Rob Challen
047 */
048public interface DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser {
049
050        /**
051         * Create an {@link InHostPhenomenologicalState} from a phenomenological
052         * configuration.
053         *
054         * <p>
055         * The default implementation samples incubation, time to peak and recovery
056         * delays, and calibrates the viral load and immune response models using
057         * {@link BiPhasicLogistic} helper methods. Demographic adjustments are
058         * applied before sampling.
059         *
060         * @param configuration the phenomenological in‑host configuration
061         * @param execConfig    execution configuration providing contextual rates
062         * @param person        optional demographic used to apply demographic
063         *                      adjustments
064         * @param rng           sampler used to draw from distributions
065         * @param time          current simulation time used to timestamp the state
066         * @return an initial {@link InHostPhenomenologicalState}
067         */
068        default InHostPhenomenologicalState initialiseInHostModel(
069                        PhenomenologicalModel configuration, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig,
070                        Optional<PersonDemographic> person, Sampler rng, int time
071        ) {
072
073                if (person.isPresent()) {
074                        configuration = ReflectionUtils.modify(
075                                        configuration, execConfig.getDemographicAdjustment(),
076                                        person.get()
077                        );
078                }
079                double incubation = configuration.getIncubationPeriod().sample(rng);
080                return ImmutableInHostPhenomenologicalState.builder().setTime(time)
081                                .setInfectiousnessCutoff(configuration.getInfectiousnessCutoff())
082                                .setViralLoadModel(
083                                                BiPhasicLogistic.calibrateViralLoad(
084                                                                incubation, // onsetTime
085                                                                configuration.getIncubationToPeakViralLoadDelay()
086                                                                                .sample(rng), // peakTime,
087                                                                configuration.getPeakToRecoveryDelay().sample(rng), // double
088                                                                                                                                                                                                                // duration,
089                                                                configuration.getInfectiousnessCutoff(), // double
090                                                                                                                                                                                // thresholdLevel,
091                                                                configuration.getApproxPeakViralLoad().sample(rng)// double
092                                                                                                                                                                                                        // peakLevel
093                                                )
094                                )
095                                .setImmunityModel(
096                                                BiPhasicLogistic.calibrateImmuneActivity(
097                                                                configuration.getPeakImmuneResponseDelay().sample(rng), // peakTime,
098                                                                configuration.getApproxPeakImmuneResponse().sample(rng), // peakLevel,
099                                                                configuration.getImmuneWaningHalfLife().sample(rng) // halfLife
100                                                )
101                                ).build();
102
103        }
104
105}
